{"id":415362348,"lang":"cpp","time":"1 year, 5 months","timestamp":1604184346,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"44 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/415362348/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Recover Binary Search Tree","memory":"59 MB","code":"/**\n * Definition for a binary tree node.\n * struct TreeNode {\n *     int val;\n *     TreeNode *left;\n *     TreeNode *right;\n *     TreeNode() : val(0), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}\n *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}\n *     TreeNode(int x, TreeNode *left, TreeNode *right) : val(x), left(left), right(right) {}\n * };\n */\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n    void recoverTree(TreeNode* root) {\n        vector<TreeNode*> inorder;\n        TreeNode* prev = nullptr;\n        int l = -1;\n        function<void(TreeNode*)> dfs = [&](TreeNode* cur) -> void {\n            if (!cur) return;\n            \n            dfs(cur -> left);\n            if (prev) {\n                if (!(cur -> val > prev -> val)) {\n                    l = inorder.size();\n                }\n            }\n            inorder.push_back(cur);\n            prev = cur;\n            dfs(cur -> right);\n        };\n        dfs(root);\n        \n       \n        int f = l - 1;\n        while(f > 0 && inorder[f - 1] -> val > inorder[l] -> val) {\n            --f;\n        }\n        \n        swap(inorder[f] -> val,\n             inorder[l] -> val);\n        \n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"recover-binary-search-tree"}
